This series of bills reflects a bipartisan commitment to strengthening and supporting America‚Äôs small businesses. When they succeed, we all succeed. 8/8

Two more bills, which passed by votes of 421 to 0 and 416 to 3, extend the statute of limitations for fraud cases in PPP/EIDL. Fraud in small business loan programs keeps money from Americans who need it most. We want to put a stop to it. 4/8

Finally, the Strengthening Subcontracting for Small Businesses Act, which passed by a vote of 411 to 11, will ensure that federal agencies prioritize contractors who have a history of complying with small business subcontracting plans. 7/8

The Supporting Small Business and Career and Technical Education Act passed, 399 to 18. This bill directs Small Business Development Centers and Women's Business Centers to assist small businesses with hiring graduates from career and technical education programs. 6/8

Another bill, which passed by a vote of 359 to 61, revises the standards applicable to small businesses in the HUBZone program, making the program more effective at assisting firms that need help. 5/8
